And there was Martin Van Buren, too. on a Xeetle old sorrel horse,
trying to keep up alongside of lae and the Gineral; and endeavouring
to take the shine off of us by bowinÂ® and bowin2 to the folks, the
same as I and the Gineral did# But it8s no use 3 The people are so

Hurrah for Major DowningS

Hurrah for General Jackson!
Hurrah?
And there2 s such a shakin8 of white hsndkitchers out of the winders,
and so many handsome women8s eyes peepin2 down upon me and the Gineral
that 8twas enough to make a man pretty near jump out of his skin to
be taken sich notice of* The Gineral was considerable touched, l?ll

Major Downing, if I wasnH an old man ....
Never mind that, says I, Gineral, you8 re pretty tough yet, and likely
to outlive many a younger man* Besides, you are a widower.
That8 s what I was thinkin8 about. Major.
Hurrah for the President!
Then he turned up his face and winked at a pretty girl that was shskin8
her handkitcher out of a chamber winder.
Those handsome women are enough to make a man think of marryin8 again.
But 1% so old. Major Downing.
A fig for that, gineral: the gals don3t like you any the worse for your
hair being grey: for youl>ve got plenty of it, such as it is. But if
the gals in New York won81 have you, there9 s. plenty down East that will.
